django.utils.lorem_ipsum

Utility functions for generating “lorem ipsum” Latin text.

Attributes

COMMON_P

WORDS

COMMON_WORDS

Functions

sentence()

Return a randomly generated sentence of lorem ipsum text.

paragraph()

Return a randomly generated paragraph of lorem ipsum text.

paragraphs(count[, common])

Return a list of paragraphs as returned by paragraph().

words(count[, common])

Return a string of count lorem ipsum words separated by a single space.

Module Contents

django.utils.lorem_ipsum.COMMON_P = 'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut...[source]
django.utils.lorem_ipsum.WORDS = ('exercitationem', 'perferendis', 'perspiciatis', 'laborum', 'eveniet', 'sunt', 'iure', 'nam',...[source]
django.utils.lorem_ipsum.COMMON_WORDS = ('lorem', 'ipsum', 'dolor', 'sit', 'amet', 'consectetur', 'adipisicing', 'elit', 'sed', 'do',...[source]
django.utils.lorem_ipsum.sentence()[source]

Return a randomly generated sentence of lorem ipsum text.

The first word is capitalized, and the sentence ends in either a period or question mark. Commas are added at random.

django.utils.lorem_ipsum.paragraph()[source]

Return a randomly generated paragraph of lorem ipsum text.

The paragraph consists of between 1 and 4 sentences, inclusive.

django.utils.lorem_ipsum.paragraphs(count, common=True)[source]

Return a list of paragraphs as returned by paragraph().

If common is True, then the first paragraph will be the standard ‘lorem ipsum’ paragraph. Otherwise, the first paragraph will be random Latin text. Either way, subsequent paragraphs will be random Latin text.

django.utils.lorem_ipsum.words(count, common=True)[source]

Return a string of count lorem ipsum words separated by a single space.

If common is True, then the first 19 words will be the standard ‘lorem ipsum’ words. Otherwise, all words will be selected randomly.
